TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class HttpCookie : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, Java.Lang.ICloneable

.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit HttpCookie extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.Lang.ICloneable, class System.IDisposable
type HttpCookie = class inherit Object interface ICloneable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable

Docs.summary: An HttpCookie object represents an HTTP cookie, which carries state information between server and user agent.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Java.Net.HttpCookie> Parse(string header) cil managed

Docs.param: a String specifying the set-cookie header. The header should start with "set-cookie", or "set-cookie2" token; or it should have no leading token at all.
Docs.summary: Constructs cookies from set-cookie or set-cookie2 header string.
Docs.returns: a List of cookie parsed from header line string

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the string does not comply with cookie specification, or the cookie name contains illegal characters, or reserved tokens of cookie specification appears
if header string violates the cookie specification's syntax or the cookie name contains illegal characters.
if the header string is null

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Path : string with get, set

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Secure : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns true if sending this cookie should be restricted to a secure protocol, or false if the it can be sent using any protocol. -or- Indicates whether the cookie should only be sent using a secure protocol, such as HTTPS or SSL.
Docs.value: false if the cookie can be sent over any standard protocol; otherwise, true

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Version : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns the version of the protocol this cookie complies with. -or- Sets the version of the cookie protocol this cookie complies with.
Docs.value: 0 if the cookie complies with the original Netscape specification; 1 if the cookie complies with RFC 2965/2109
